text.__SUMMARY__: Asparagus litoralis, common name coastal asparagus,  is an evergreen perennial plant species belonging to the genus Asparagus in the monocot family Asparagaceae. A. litoralis can be found in England, Ukraine (known as Kholodok pryberezhny), Russia (known as Sparzha pribrezhnaya), Bulgaria (known as Asperja) and Turkey (known as Kiyi asparagusu).  It commonly grows on the coast of a country where it derives its name.
text.Description:
Asparagus litoralis is an herbaceous perennial that grows up to 30–50 centimetres (12–20 in) of height. The top of the branches is where flowers normally bloom. In May and June the flowers bloom and in July and August it starts bearing fruit. The population has been declining and is not overly abundant. It is normally pollinated by bumble bees.
